a-hApDBcn810AZt4v39vCQ.text: I like the Builders Arms a lot, but I won't call it adorable. Still, this is a great local that manages to feature some sophistication in terms of its offerings whilst still being able to be filled to the gills and dripping with pints for a big football match. The place isn't huge, but it has enough different spaces that you can normally find somewhere to sit (don't forget to check upstairs). They've got a good number of beers on tap and a good selection of bottled beer as well. There's also a full bar, and typically a decent choice of wine too, although the bartenders are assiduous in their use of those (tiny) measuring cups, much to this American drinkers chagrin.Despite the proletarian name, the drinks aren't really cheap, and this place knows what kind of neighborhood it is in. They shut up shop early round these parts so you'll have to hit the high street or better yet the tube by 10:50 - I was even here once for a New Years Eve party and they had the place cleared out by 12:15.

GP1jMzMXh62c0DF5HioUJA.text: This is the only bar I've ever been to in the South Kensington area, and my Imperial College friends always bring me back here again and again. But I've to admit its a great place to sit down, drink and chat for a few hours (as long as you don't go during a student night). Staff can be a bit slow and unhelpful when things get busy, especially when their talking to some of the customers, but otherwise it's good. You'll find the usual selection of beer and cider on the tap, plus pub food (and more surprisingly). Prices are reasonable, especially given the area.

x15Fnr-hya6AwfmSu_WU8A.text: Excellent friendly pub in just behind High Street Kensington station, but far enough behind it that it's a bit of a 'hidden gem'. Saturday night featured Landlord, Deuchers and Swing Low on tap, plus a wide range of continental lagers and some excellent wine. I had a few tasty bar snacks, the wedges in particular were great, but for some reason best known to myself didn't get an amazing looking burger. There's a heated smoking area outside and plenty of comfy seating and mood lighting on the inside. And I'd been here before...

bfGd0NZLNliM37QHTRU_7A.text: Needed a Sunday lunch place to meet up with old friends while we were visiting London recently and found this place through web research. It's conveniently located just off the hustle and bustle of High St. Kensington. Very quick walk from the High St. Ken underground metro stop. The reviews indicated that the food here is top notch gastro pub. I reserved a large table well ahead of time. When we got there our table was all ready for us (even had my name on the table). Although being a Sunday it felt like they hadn't quite recovered from the previous night.  Our waiter was brand new so wasn't quite familiar with the menu yet but he did a decent job and no orders were missed or dropped. The food was great! I shared a roast chicken with all the trimmings with my daughter and hubbie got the lamb. Others had fish and chips and roast beef. All in all an excellent meal. Can't give a review for night time though as we were there for Sunday lunch.

puZVvr9GL2o0T3SDyxcYLw.text: Really nice pub in a quiet neighborhood between Kensington High Street and Gloucester Road. It's comfy inside, with a choice of tables and one or two sofas. Lots of choice on tap, including a couple of ciders. For food, the mains are all quite good, though the appetizer/snacks can be a bit on the skimpy side. The service was a bit slow once when we were in because of some problems with the kitchen, apparently. I saw the bar staff chew out the cook, and at least one customer asked for their money back. I've been three other times, though, and had no problems; in fact, the last time the service was very attentive. You can book a spot to watch their free movies on Sunday nights in an upstairs room. As if you needed another excuse to go to the pub. There are some nice benches outside. It's a great place to people-watch.

jokfRpiogPLD5A-mMWjlXA.text: This was my bar when I went to school at Richmond.   The perfect neighborhood pub, it was always a cozy respite on a cold night.

DpEc_j89J9KrAeE57-ytVw.text: I almost do not want to tell anyone about this spot since it is so authentic and a haven from the touristy spots in the city. We had the beef pie and a friend had a club and another friend had the [huge] burger. Great chips (French fries). Perfect off-the-beaten path spot if you're on Kensington High Street doing some shopping, as we were.

_g7GyJvXozhFJjn1qFUuxA.text: This is one of the most laid back "urban" (in terms of location) pubs I've ever been to. Despite being in a very affluent part of the city, you never feel excluded or an outcast. Both the staff and the patrons were all smiles and eager to crack jokes. The food was good and served in a timely manner. It had a diverse menu without excluding the pub classics. Great beer and pretty reasonable prices.

aY2TjUPRFD6ei9y8RcqHAw.text: This is a brilliant place to have a quiet drink or meal. The food is proper comfort food, perfect on a cold day. the beer selection is wide, the bar staff are chatty and the general atmosphere is nice. It is filled with young people which gives it a trendy vibe but is not overtaken by loud and annoying teenagers. Great place to enjoy a comfortable evening with some friends and feel right at home!

8eKf5_bw1gzecTRAq1-Z4Q.text: The pub was excellent.A great range of drinks and very good value food.They have two meal,two drink total for 15 pounds.Really a bargain especially in this area.The atmopshere in this pub was also excellent.High recommended for drink and food in this area.

vvTKQM5pv0ooA-u5zfGzjQ.text: A lovely little pub. A great place for lunches and they have a good selection of beers (lots of organic ones too). Friendly bar staff, film nights and in a pretty part of town make it worth a trip.

nOZ_X9bySLfAUEBnt0c_yg.text: Awesome place to hangout after a long day of studying. The pub offers the best choices of Ale's and Cider. An recommended pint should suggest is the Ubu Pure Ale, simply the best drink ever. Unfortunately the bad cons are is that all pubs closes at 11pm. As result the entire pub experience is truly the best and is fantastic for people like me who needs a place to relax after work.

VsLnN8Owuk4ftfdGBFGy5Q.text: I had two very different experiences on two different occasions at the Builders Arms.AS A PUB it was terrific: four types of cider on tap, a down tempo vibe, quiet enough in the early evening to have a conversation. I liked it so much for drinking I figured I'd come back for SUNDAY ROAST. That's when things went downhill fast: they were out of chicken, they were out of sea bass, they could neither confirm nor deny the presence of dairy in the nut loaf for a lactose intolerant friend...Forty-five minutes pass and our friends receive their lunches: fish & chips and roast pork (cold.) It's another 15 until we get ours. Though I've ordered beef the server (who admitted the day had been a disaster) brings me and my dining companion pork and says, "Sorry we gave away the last beef, here's pork." I didn't order pork. I didn't want pork. My consolation prize? Free dessert. Bits of my meal, like our friend's, were also cold. Warm roastie, cold mash...you get the picture.I'd definitely not return to the Builders Arms for food. I might consider it for a drink but not without some hesitation. I had so hoped this homey pub might become my local. As of now, I'm still looking.

OQi1oOlXswd2eG7z0MPyvg.text: We were turned away in the pouring rain last night because we had a child with us. We were told it's house policy not to seat children after 6PM although that policy is listed nowhere on their web site nor in their reservation system at this time. I explained that we had come some distance to have dinner there to no avail. As my five-year old son began crying about being hungry and being made by a cold staff member to think it was somehow his fault that we couldn't sit at one of the many tables available we were turned out hungry and wet with an inconsolable child. If you find this experience at odds with the warm, inviting story they spin about themselves, please do spend your money elsewhere.

p65rysq-YMe8Fn2-KZ8RZg.text: This is my favorite pub in London.  All pubs have different personalities and so does Builder's Arms.  The service is excellent and the choice of Bitters is always very good.  I have never seen any other American's there except for one time running into Dustin Hoffman.

21MGHXANG5x6Q2nqoIIbPQ.text: I love the British pub culture, but I have yet to be blown away by any particular pub. Good size place, good drinks, good food.Highlights:- Plenty of space to sit at happy hour.- In the unapologetically posh Kensington. - The crispy white bait was very good!Lowlights: -  In the unapologetically posh Kensington.Overall, this is a very short review because it wasn't bad or good. It is a great place to meet up with people, have a pint and a chat and then be on your way!

WKuffnS9w0g--v2ATQHSkg.text: Don't order mixed drinks... They pour them very weak and charge a premium for them. Good beer. Nice upstairs room.

L7uaaL5xafo-ot82RfQpfw.text: Not a bad pub, it just doesn't really stand out in the Land of Pubs Far 'n Wide. Typical laid-back pub atmosphere with a robust variety of beers, wines, and ciders available. Friendly service. We only had drinks and didn't try any of the food, however.

KMrEdeqQ2ZXThB_3nYcgBw.text: After reading some previous reviews I had some high hopes. However upon our arrival it was clear we were not really as welcomed guests. The staff was a but rude and seemed bothered. Yet most of the customers were friendly and easy to join conversations. If I were back in London I would give it another shot but won't be raving about this place to my friends.

jJ6V8KFfshGplFmqaO9t6g.text: Stopped for a pint, but seemed like they had a good menu.  Seems popular with the locals.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Off the normal path little way from High Street.

Q_p5dsMVdv42e5k8Lx8DTw.text: Amazing pub, this has now become my local despite not being local!!! The staff are fun and friendly and the vibe in the place is great no matter what day you go. It does attract a great crowd despite being off the main highway. Food is good too, definitely recommend it for a relaxed evening or Sunday afternoon.

1Gn6CUZ1k8AWygegMd6ReQ.text: A goodlooking pub let down by slow service. The fish pie was a-okay....Hmm maybe they need to sort out some management issues there!

-5cVTnkCszWxveeCbob0RA.text: 4 types of cider... ON TAP! The awesomeness that is this can give this pub one star for each variety. It's a lovely corner pub with good service, great drinks selection, and on this quite street it makes it pretty perfect to stand outside in summer and sit on the pavement. Being in this area makes it full of posh chaps in brown leather shoes and foppish Hugh Grant esq hair cuts but don't let that put you off, it's very laid back and great for an after work pint.I haven't tried their food but by the looks of it, its popular. A great summer pub!

PuTQ0sp0-zml5E6La2T0Zw.text: Having lived in the area, this was always the place to go for a relaxed, authentic pub experience on a charming and quiet road in Kensington. Just a few blocks away from a few contrived "pubs," off Gloucester, Builders Arms was refreshing, tucked away, and a perfect example of your laid back British pub. When it was nice out, it was great to sit outside and enjoy a beer - it may just require a stake-out. Quieter, more cozy seating is available upstairs, too! The bartenders were always friendly, they offered good, standard pub fare and the street it sits on is so gorgeous, a part of me always wanted to charge the neighborhood doors to make sure they weren't a fake set. If you're as strange as me, you may have the urge to do something like that.. but um, don't. Stupid.. er.. Americans.

5MEw--v1cpXWqApKr7y2SQ.text: My roommates and I came here quite a few times during our stint in London and it's a great neighborhood bar---very chill with an awesome selection of beers, yummy burgers and interesting seating.Unfortunately it, like most bars in Kensington, closes at 11pm, so it's a good place to get your night started if you're out and about on the weekend and a fantastic place for relaxing after work.

2Bhzy9bk4umZME12YdSiXw.text: Everyone has to have a local. The pub they frequent while in London and The Builders Arm became mine, but not initially. Having lived right in Kensington on Queen's Gate (study abroad housing), many people, including myself, frequented a pub right around the corner, The Queens Arm. One evening, however, my friends and I decided to travel a few more blocks to a tucked away pub we had spotted on a walk.After that, The Builders Arms became our local. I was captivated with a warm and charming atmosphere-- the eclectic furniture and lamps, the cozy upstairs nook. And, of course, I loved the bartenders... Alex and Ray. The pints were plentiful and the food was worth snacking on... definitely worth the walk out of SW7.

gh2zjYDudspQWqEdOfPvvA.text: Builders Arms is one of the local pubs in my area. I have to admit that I'm not much of a drinker, but this is the perfect place to just hang-out and socialise with friends. The few minutes walk from home is also an added benefit, especially when it's a late winters night - well, I am a girl! The pub is quietly tucked away behind the fashionable Kensington High Street, so getting transport home is easy with the Underground Station only a few minutes walk and taxis always within easy reach. Modern decor with a slightly more homely feel, an all round good pub if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom. Builders Arms, Kensington Court, W8

HabI5TOVcaM4GPVR6B5vaA.text: Builders Arms offers a decent selection of beer and cider as well as nice staff, but it's a victim of its own success, sadly: it's far too crowded on busy nights.  Try to go here on quiet nights or during slow times of the day.

9Nnzm_WI6V28YKGtfY6iMQ.text: Sandwiches are definitely sub-par, but the rest of the pub is pretty cool.  Lots of different drinks on tap, and a long list of wines are available.  Next time I'll try a real main course as the menu looked pretty exciting.

U1PLOKHezaHh5DfRRNxcMA.text: I'm reluctant to call a pub adorable, but the Builders Arms is coloured baby blue, has a charming little patio, and sits on a picturesque corner in well-to-do Kensington (across from a cupcake shop no less).  The interior is less adorable but still cosy - the downstairs seating is a well-placed mix of high and low tables and sofas with pleasant lighting, and it's a perfectly comfortable spot to catch up with friends over pints or a bottle of wine (very reasonably priced).  I tend to seek out bar snacks and here you can get nuts, wasabi peas, chili crackers and/or olives, as well as order something more substantial from a decidedly sophisticated menu.  We stuck with chips and a hummus platter on my last visit (nothing exciting there), but I saw some interesting plates float by that I'm eager to try on my next visit.  On the downside, service is friendly but not at all proactive.

photos.caption: Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom

LIsXrweBNvp2f6Gt-6wL2Q.text: best fish and chips I had in my 3 months in London. This is the best pub I have been to during my time spent in London. They also had the best hot chocolate. I will miss this place when I'm back in the states!!

1spwdJZusC43V-SVujO1Sw.text: Old but modern in this posh neighborhood, we were happy to see a small crowd out front enjoying some drinks. Prices are reasonable with complimentary cucumber water. Nice wine menu along with the good bet selection. Comfortable and low key, will come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom. Wine list September 2018
Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom. Pint of Camden Town IPA

iiSPrNmggK0JypSNKIK_hQ.text: Nothing special. The menu was largely burgers and similar. If you're expecting a phenomenal gastropub experience you'll find it elsewhere. Until further notice I'm going back to the Scarsdale.

zieBAJouC_D12Q0Z9Xa6Jw.text: I love sitting outside. A great pub tucked into a fabulous residential neighborhood. The staff have always been friendly and helpful.

e7klHTRVHpoOd1f4TCa4ow.text: Tried the 28-day aged rib of beef with orange.. HUGE portions and really delicious. The gammon was slightly too salty but everything else was great. The Yorkshire pudding was also really buttery and crunchy.

photos.caption: Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom. Sunday menu
Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom

keoKfrw9DrEpwk2IG1JtKw.text: This place was happening on a Friday night.  You order at the bar and they bring your food to the table. I got the chicken pie with veggies and mash. Very flakey crust and tasty creamy chicken filling.  I tried my friends sausage and it was also very flavorful.  My other friend said she liked our food better than her burger. The ciders were good, too. Very nice and helpful staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom. Yummy chicken pot pie and mash potatoes. Pretty good pub food!

NYzBAUHBU2VCmRfDeMeGhA.text: Great little pub in Kensington. I had the beef and bone marrow pie with a Fullers ale to wash it down. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and food was delicious. With so many pubs in London, it's difficult to choose. I was very pleased with this one. Definitely recommended.

Oe32e2SuiJeXv8h9WWAbmw.text: I was hoping for good things when I stepped foot into Builders Arms, but was left feeling unwelcome and my wallet quite a bit lighter.It was my last night in London and was staying at one of London Perfect's apartments just down the street. Walking aimlessly looking for a pub or café to work from, I happened upon Builders Arms. I remember seeing it during a tour of Kensington earlier in the week, so figured I'd give it a try.-Unwelcome-The moment I walked in I felt it felt as though nobody cared of my existence. It wasn't that busy, and all I wanted was a table for myself. Finally, the hostess comes up from chatting with her colleague and welcomes me with a cold hello. I ask her for a table for one, in which she looks around at the empty tables and points to a shelved window area, tucked around the corner next to the kitchen.-Unpleasant Staff-Up until now, my experience with staff at hotels, restaurants, cafes, and pubs in London were more than pleasant. In fact, I'd give them all 5-stars, unlike this review. Every staff member at Builders Arms was sour and unpleasant. It's understandable if 1 or maybe 2 staff have shitty attitudes, because I'm sure working in the service industry has to be rough, but it was as though I shit in their cereal that morning.After my cold greeting from the hostess, who didn't provide me with a menu, I sat and waited for 20-minutes before deciding to take action. Was I wrong in thinking they would come over and ask me if I wanted something? I guess so. Sitting right next to the pub's computer, which had staff member after staff member using it and passing right by me, I ask this bald man with tattoos if I could have a menu. With hesitation and almost disgust on his face, he grabs one from the table and gives it to me. I mention his look, because I'm more than certain he was the manager, perhaps even the owner? Later I heard him swearing and throwing things around in the kitchen. Super friendly dude, no?Finally, a waiter decides to help me after I turn and ask him if I can order. Key phrase: "I turn and ask him if I can order." As if they're doing me a favor.-Upsold Everything and Wrong Orders-I write about lifestyle and travel for a living. So spending a lot of money on food and drinks is pretty normal. However, one thing I look for when dealing with restaurants is how they try to upsell things. It started with the wine. I asked for a bottle of a Spanish red, and without hesitation he upsold me to a wine that I know for a fact is underrated. I let it go, because maybe he really thought it was better choice, but then he upsold me on my meal.A big no-no in my book is when you order a bottle of wine and it gets delivered uncorked. I won't go too much into this, but just know that isn't exactly normal. You should be offered to taste it first, and if you know what you're doing, smell the cork, too. I'm no expert in wine tasting, but I know that much. Another pet peeve is when a wine is "recommended" and the incorrect bottle shows up (LOL). Instead of a 2008, a 2010 was there. This left me with many questions.-Food-I'll just leave you with this: The roast was overrated, carrots were under cooked, and the potatoes were over cooked.*For those that lasted this long throughout the post.*Some of you reading this, especially fans of this place, might wonder why I stayed around for all of this and put up with it. When you're reviewing a place, it's best to not make it known you're doing so. Popping into a restaurant or pub is the best way to get the true feel for a place. I don't consider this a wasted trip, and as always, recommend you to try this place out for yourself. Hopefully it's better than what I experienced.

NAaaFft5Os9wDDb-DsO1sg.text: Ate here on my first and last nights in London. The staff are awesome. Cute ambiance. The food is excellent and reasonably priced. I had fish and chips and then a burger. Highly recommended.

Was1wrZWGC0OsVKdkDVsEw.text: Lively neighborhood pub! We went on the recommendation of our hotel concierge and he hit the nail on the head. We were clearly the only non locals but were warmly served. Younger neighborhood crowd. Food was great too - burned the insides of my mouth but that's a great thing with fish and chips -perfectly crisp on the outside with flaky deliciousness inside

photos.caption: Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom

cmv_DDEU3LNDO1WAqQINJg.text: I arrived in London after 17 hours of travel from the US.  Was very tired but wanted to find something very traditional for my first meal.  I found this place because I searched for Sunday Roast....and it was great.  The staff there was very welcoming even though I didn't know how anything worked. (order at the bar, pay up front, etc) all things we do differently in the US.  AND there was a big Rugby game on that the had the place filled.Food was excellent and just what I was looking for for my first meal in the UK.

JNceyEpH4_CMfocIcgnq0Q.text: I really enjoyed my visit to Builders Arms.  I'm rarely in Kensington but when I went to meet a friend, this pub was in my Bookmarks for some reason and so we decided to check it out.  It was a Saturday night and it was buzzing!!  Thankfully we were able to find a spot and the bar staff were good about attending to everyone quickly so the wait time wasn't long.  The prices are quite reasonable, especially given the location.  The only disappointing factor is that they close before midnight.  Last call is early and I believe we had to leave by 11:15.  But all in all, a fun night at Builders Arms.

w2YOwaz0WSEOSyLpV5CA7g.text: NY has some really good gastropubs now but no one does it better than the Brits when it comes to providing great food alongside with a great bar. So when we needed some pre-show grub near the Royal Albert Hall we decided to come here. The downstairs was a bit crowded and loud so we sat upstairs. I ordered a glass of blush wine and we shared two plates - the classic dish of sausages and mash potatoes and a dish of braised pork belly, chorizo and barley. Both plates were tremendous! The sausages were tasty and even the mashed potatoes were better than most I've had. The pork belly was perfectly tender and matched well with the spicy chorizo and the slightly crunchy barley. I'm really curious how they maintained the barley's texture. In any case it was delicious and reasonably prices as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Builders Arms - London, United Kingdom. Pork belly, chorizo, barley

sDjnPzmuv1GcZVH2DCsLVQ.text: Builder's Arms is definitely one of the best pubs in the area (which is not really known for pubs, being so posh and all).  The beer selection is good, with a few rarities, and some good Meantime choices in particular.  Downstairs is bright and boisterous, while a very nice upstairs is more calm and comfortable, with a skylight providing some much-needed airiness.  The food was very good, and reasonably priced, with the exception of £14 for a burger--but, if that is what you crave, you can always go on Monday, which is £10 burger night.  Staff were young, friendly, and helpful.  Clientele is a mixed bag.  You get get a lot of students (esp. American ones) from Richmond University down the road.  But, considering the neighbourhood, it could easily be full of posh twits, Tories, or posh Tory twits, so one must count one's blessings.

IZn4_Ou0UqKXOXHVUgp3JQ.text: Great local spot. Plenty of beer choices and places to sit upstairs / outside to relax.

BDegFlGWxuBG8vhYW2Jf3w.text: Great old pub in residential street between Cromwell Rd and High street Kensington.  Food - getting better all the time.  Hard to get a seat inside sometimes - but on a warm night you can sit outside or even on the curb.  Minors not permitted after 8pm.   Can be noisy.  Very busy Friday and Saturday nights.

4NzoT29DpLGbdrNool5sKQ.text: I popped in while wondering through the neighborhood.Loved to see it filled with a happy hour crowd.The Monday night special is a great deal. Although I wish I had the option to upgrade to a larger drink that came with the meal.The burger was tasty. And thought the onion rings were some of the best I ever had.

ZB1NOaeCOoas1v_42Z9fqA.text: 1 Kensington Court Place London W8 5BJ - such a cool, chic British vibe - posh neighborhoodEmily Rose Reeder

QSg0UfXs_eyspmz9iTciEg.text: Love this place. The tapas selection is good value for money and the black pudding is yummy. Good selection of beers and wines with good matchings on their food menu. The outside area is cute but obviously get busy in the summer, just wish it was a bit bigger sometimes.

dsrae2upjLcqSgfHHxnxng.text: This place is awesome.  - Super good selection of Ales, Bitters, Belgians, and Ciders- Really cool location on a quiet street.- Relaxing upstairs area for privacy with your friends.- Great atmosphere for sipping on beer with your mates.- Plenty of space to hang out.  Even during Happy Hour.I love it

3A9NPIZ24Ko0ADroy5PtYQ.text: Really great place to grab a pint with friends after a long day. Great staff and service. No complaints!
